content.value: Taoqi is the director of border defense at the Ministry of Development. Despite her seemingly laid-back demeanor, she consistently proves to be a dependable and supportive individual, always lending her hand to those in need. Taoqi is not only a reliable colleague, but also a trustworthy friend that people can confide in.

review.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Taoqi is a 4-star Havoc Broadblade wielder that has the option to act as a Hybrid or Support in endgame content, though due to her slow attack animations, low damage and Concerto Energy generation, she is usually forced into the Support role. It is further accentuated by her limited access to her Forte Gauge ability outside of her Intro Skill, which is not always accessible. Fortunately, her Resonance Skill, combined with the occasional use of her Outro that boosts Resonance Skill damage by 38% for next char, allows her to act as a somewhat viable Support.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Resonance Skill emits a pulse around her causing Havoc damage in its radius scaling on her DEF%. This also heals her and summons Rocksteady Shield with 3 charges, where each charge can absorb a single hit from the enemy, reducing damage taken by 15%. This shield is transferable and thus can benefit other characters when you switch.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Forte Gauge can accumulate up to 3 charges, which are generated by consumption or expiry of her Rocksteady Shield charges in a ratio of 1:1. A handy trick to note is that Taoqi’s Basic Attack 4 will consume all her currently active Rocksteady Shield charges regardless of their remaining duration, immediately granting her a full Forte Gauge. She can access and then expend these Forte charges by using a Strategic Parry with her Heavy Attack or Intro Skill to then be able to launch a sequence of enhanced Basic Attacks scaling on her DEF% while generating much more Concerto Energy, Resonance Energy and a team wide shield scaling on her DEF%!","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Ultimate Skill deals a large amount of Havoc damage in a cleaving pattern in front of her, which scales on her DEF%. When built as Hybrid, it can hit quite hard but regardless of playstyle its most important utility is Concerto Energy generation for Taoqi.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her field time will vary according to her chosen build. When played as Support, she can spend significantly less time on the field, with the option to situationally weave in her enhanced attacks from her Forte skill at cost of more field time. Alternatively, when played as Hybrid her field time grows significantly to cycle her Concerto properly by factoring in her Forte Gauge combo. The result of this is much easier access to her 38% Resonance Skill amplification compared to when played as a support and proper access to her shielding capabilities tied to her Forte combo. Players must choose between a fast supportive playstyle with limited access to Taoqi’s outro and shielding capabilities or a much slower and dangerous playstyle with full access.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"She lands on the easier side of the play difficulty spectrum while being played as support. However, if you are playing her as Hybrid, it will require you to build her Concerto Energy in a timely manner increasing the difficulty due to her slow standard and enhanced Basic Attacks. This has to be done with care so Taoqi doesn’t end up causing the team to lose more damage than she can bring due to hogging the field time.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her preferred choice of set and Echo is the popular combination of Bell-Borne Geochelone Echo & 5P Rejuvenating Glow, which allows her to grant a semi-permanent ATK% boost, temporary DMG% boost and protection from a set number of attacks. In case another character is using the above set or you wish to play her as Hybrid, she can make use of the 5P Moonlit Glow and Impermanence Heron Echo combo instead.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Overall, Taoqi is currently sparsely used in Tower of Adversary, thanks to a multitude of factors the biggest of which are her sluggish gameplay which takes more field time compared to her alternatives, her vulnerability to interruptions and finally her lack of synergistic characters to play alongside. In conclusion Her Support role is easier and takes less field time but restricts access to her Outro amplification , while on the other hand, Hybrid is harder, takes more field time but offers consistent access to not only her Outro amplification but also teamwide shields. Neither of these options are currently popular but as new encounters and characters release Taoqi may find her time to shine.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

pros.raw: {"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can apply shields to the entire team when able to execute her Forte combo","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Can heal and effortlessly enable the 5P Healer set bonus meaning she doesn’t need to sacrifice her weapon choice like many other supports","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Her Resonance skill damage reduction buff persists through character switching","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has a powerful Resonance Skill amplification buff Outro","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Has the ability to mitigate some damage from big hits with her parry","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"list-item"}],"nodeType":"unordered-list"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"}],"nodeType":"document"}

cons.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"unordered-list","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Lacks a dedicated Main DPS that can make use of her Deepen Outro","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Requires longer on-field time to generate Concerto compared to most other characters in the support or hybrid role","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Has no currently beneficial supportive Sequences available even after acquiring dupes, compared to competitors granting up to 20% ATK.","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]},{"nodeType":"list-item","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Has some of the slowest attack animations of any character in the game opening her up to being interrupted by enemy attacks","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

echo_sets.name: Rejuvenating Glow
echo_sets.notes: Offers a 10% unconditional Healing% boost and most importantly a 15% ATK% boost for the entire team, lasting 30 seconds whenever you heal yourself or any of your allies. This bonus can be triggered by the character abilities and weapon effects, is easy to keep active 100% of the time, and is a big help for all party members.
